first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[1_R 11,29]]At that time Jeroboam left Jerusalem, and the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite met him on the road. The two were alone in the area, and the prophet was wearing a new cloak.
[[1_R 11,30]]Ahijah took off his new cloak, tore it into twelve pieces,
[[1_R 11,31]]and said to Jeroboam: "Take ten pieces for yourself; the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I will tear away the kingdom from Solomon's grasp and will give you ten of the tribes.
[[1_R 11,32]]One tribe shall remain to him for the sake of David my servant, and of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.
[[1_R 12,19]]and Israel went into rebellion against David's house to this day.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 81,10]]"There shall be no strange god among you 
nor shall you worship any alien god.
[[Ps 81,11a]]I, the LORD, am your God
[[Ps 81,11b]]who led you forth from the land of Egypt."

[[Ps 81,12]]But my people did not listen to my words; 
Israel did not obey me.
[[Ps 81,13]]So I gave them up to the hardness of their hearts; 
they walked according to their own counsels."

[[Ps 81,14]]"If only my people would hear me, 
and Israel walk in my ways,
[[Ps 81,15]]Quickly would I humble their enemies; 
against their foes I would turn my hand."

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 7,31]]Jesus left the district of Tyre and went by way of Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, into the district of the Decapolis.
[[Mc 7,32]]And people brought to him a deaf man who had a speech impediment and begged him to lay his hand on him.
[[Mc 7,33]]He took him off by himself away from the crowd. He put his finger into the man's ears and, spitting, touched his tongue;
[[Mc 7,34]]then he looked up to heaven and groaned, and said to him, "Ephphatha!" (that is, "Be opened!")
[[Mc 7,35]]And (immediately) the man's ears were opened, his speech impediment was removed, and he spoke plainly.
[[Mc 7,36]]He ordered them not to tell anyone. But the more he ordered them not to, the more they proclaimed it.
[[Mc 7,37]]They were exceedingly astonished and they said, "He has done all things well. He makes the deaf hear and (the) mute speak."
